About Me

  • Published 22 Oct 2015
  • Category meta
  • Previous
  • Next

Hello.

I am a twenty something nerd. This is my personal website, and it is named after a pretty great Beat Happening song. I've taken the unusual decision to write this profile in the first person.

What I Do

I work as a QA/Developer-in-test at OpenCredo, an open-source software consultancy, and you can read a more professional work profile over here. If I was really pressed to describe what I do (say, on a quiz show, with Alexander Armstrong hoping I say "musician" or "astronaut" or something else fun), I would probably just say software developer - but I'm a specialist in testing. If you're interested in hiring me, LinkedIn is the place. Go nuts.

Interests

In my spare time, I try to studiously avoid being a massive hipster, but I've generally not been too successful. Here are some varied interests:

  • Quizzes
  • Indiepop music
  • Videogames
  • Independent cinema
  • Geocaching
  • Existentialist woe
  • Awful puns
  • Liberal politics / economics

Places you can find me

There are also some places on the internet you can find me that I don't mind sharing.

  • This blog
  • Twitter
  • Github
  • Stack Overflow
  • LinkedIn
  • Last.fm

What I've worked on

It could have been a brilliant career.

  • Hearthwiz - A personal project, a Hearthstone webapp written in Rails.
  • ITV Player - Automated functional testing, performance testing, manual testing, and general team pessimist.
  • Sedex Advance - Functional test developer. Refactorer-in-chief.
  • useMango - Lead tester. Not enough influence to change that awful name.
  • Top secret government stuff - I'm not supposed to talk about this.

Thanks

Oh yeah, thanks for reading!
